author: Special Correspondent
text:
Residents of Srirangam, under the banner of Srirangam Residential Property Retrieval Committee, formed a human chain demanding the State government to take steps to solve the dispute between the Srirangam temple authorities and residents over the ownership of properties in the temple town.

A large number of residents including women and elders took part in the human chain protest.

Starting from Ranga-Ranga gopuram, they formed a human chain up to Gandhi Road. R. Hemanathan, president, Srirangam Residential Property Retrieval Committee, K. Ragunathan, executive president were among those participated in the agitation. They highlighted the long pending issue and the plight of owners of properties. They said that the issue had not been solved for several years. With the temple authorities illegally claiming ownership of properties, no one was able to sell or pledge their properties. They also said that though the Chief Minister Jayalalithaa had promised to solve the issue when she contested from the Srirangam constituency to the State Assembly, it had not been solved.
title: Residents form human chain
